entities.name: surface
entities.description: A physical object or location where silk can attach

entities.name: RADIAL LINES
entities.description: The framework lines of a spider's web, spaced at regular intervals to form the basic shape of the web

entities.name: Prey
entities.description: Animals that are caught in the spider"s web, serving as a food source.

entities.name: spiral
entities.description: Circular silk lines forming part of a spider's web.

entities.name: tension
entities.description: The force exerted by the spider on its silk strands to ensure structural integrity and stability.

entities.name: strength
entities.description: The capacity of a material to withstand forces without breaking.

entities.name: branch
entities.description: A branch is a woody part of a tree or shrub, often used by spiders as an anchor point for their webs.

entities.name: line
entities.description: A structural element in spider webs used by spiders to build and maintain their web.

entities.name: TRAP LINE
entities.description: A thick strand of silk in a spider's web that serves as a signal line, alerting the spider to the presence of prey

entities.name: substance
entities.description: A sticky secretion produced by spiders to help trap prey on their webs.

entities.name: molecule
entities.description: A biomolecule consisting of amino acids.

entities.name: location
entities.description: A chosen area suitable for web-building by spiders.

entities.name: mating rituals
entities.description: Mating rituals are behaviors performed by spiders during the mating process.

entities.name: interval
entities.description: Regularly measured and defined distance

entities.name: wall
entities.description: A wall is a vertical structure, usually solid, that defines and sometimes protects an area. In the context of spider web-building, it can serve as a surface for anchoring silk strands.

entities.name: anchor
entities.description: An anchor serves as a point of support from which silk strands are extended to construct a web.

entities.name: framework
entities.description: The foundational layout providing support and organization within the web.

entities.name: abdomen
entities.description: The abdomen is the posterior part of a spider"s body, containing specialized glands called spinnerets that produce silk.

entities.name: shape
entities.description: The basic form created by evenly spaced radial lines.

entities.name: adhesive
entities.description: A sticky adhesive produced by spiders to help trap prey on their webs.

entities.name: protein
entities.description: A structural and functional component of living organisms.

entities.name: web
entities.description: A complex and detailed structure built by spiders.

entities.name: pattern
entities.description: Circular movement with silk laying

entities.name: structure
entities.description: An intricate network created by spiders as their homes and hunting grounds.

entities.name: radial
entities.description: The foundational structure providing support and layout for the entire web.

entities.name: SPIDERS
entities.description: Remarkably adaptive creatures known for their intricate web-building skills.

entities.name: egg sac creation
entities.description: Egg sac creation is the process by which spiders create protective structures for their eggs using silk.
